de.mrapp.android.adapter.util

Class AdapterViewUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.adapter.util.AdapterViewUtil

  • public final class AdapterViewUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides static methods, which allow to store the scroll position of adapter views such as ListView, GridView and ExpandableListView and restore it afterwards.
    Since:
    0.2.3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void onRestoreInstanceState(android.widget.AbsListView adapterView, android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState, java.lang.String key)
      Restores the previously stored state of an adapter view from a specific bundle.
      static void onSaveInstanceState(android.widget.AbsListView adapterView, android.os.Bundle outState, java.lang.String key)
      Saves the state of an adapter view within a specific bundle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public static void onSaveInstanceState(@NonNull
                                       android.widget.AbsListView adapterView,
                                       @NonNull
                                       android.os.Bundle outState,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String key)
        Saves the state of an adapter view within a specific bundle.
        Parameters:
        adapterView - The adapter view, whose state should be stored, as an instance of the class AbsListView. The adapter view may not be null
        outState - The bundle, the state should be stored within, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may not be null
        key - The key, which should be used to store the state, as a String. The key may neither be null, nor empty

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        public static void onRestoreInstanceState(@NonNull
                                          android.widget.AbsListView adapterView,
                                          @NonNull
                                          android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState,
                                          @NonNull
                                          java.lang.String key)
        Restores the previously stored state of an adapter view from a specific bundle.
        Parameters:
        adapterView - The adapter view, whose state should be restored, as an instance of the class AbsListView. The adapter view may not be null
        savedInstanceState - The bundle, the state has been stored within, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may not be null
        key - The key, which has been used to store the state, as a String. The key may neither be null, nor empty
